instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT: What is PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT? Power rail for RAM. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Brain Dead)
threads.message:
The machine came in for this problem and there are no signs of water damage anywhere. I looked under the chips as well! Went over the board half a dozen times looking for anything that could cause this. I think we are looking at a non water related issue.

I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> LB that never sends the 3.3v enable signal to turn on power to the LCD The screen never comes on and never has back light as a result.
All the power rails appear functional and voltages on the CPU are normal.

After looking at the board under thermal imaging I noticed that the RAM modules were never showing activity. What I normally observe is once CPU power is on and <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> fires up the BIOS program is loaded into ram and starts running. You can see the memory light up slightly as it comes to life. on this board it does not.

I backed up and replaced the BIOS and this did not help.

Clock signals are present.
I can watch the CPU read the BIOS on the scope.
On the memory modules MEM_( A or B) _CLK signals are both not present.
Memory 1v2 and 1v8 s3 rails are present and working properly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Brain Dead)
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Brain Dead)
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> 0.6v
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_BUF_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v

I want to add a interesting observation.
when I first power up the board it pulls 400 mA for a few seconds then powers down for a few seconds then turns on again and pulls 550-650 mA. This is not normal behavior for a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board.This however similar to the normal current on power cycle just not the power down section.   Also during the 500-600mA cycle fin spin is full speed.   Did this before I flashed the bios.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Brain Dead)
threads.message:
Did you try the MLB alone, w/o any device connected?
Use just an USB mouse for control; disconnect LIO flex too...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Brain Dead)
threads.message:
yes. LB was tested on the bench bare. I use my bench DC-IN not the one in the Machine. I have been checking for the 3.3V on signal for the minitor without a display attached. It should show up briefly but does not. Memory clk measurements were done without a display.

no mouse, no keyboard, nothing in USB ports.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Brain Dead)
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Brain Dead)
threads.message:
That was my assumption as well but I have never seen one like this. I appreciate you making me feel at ease to condemn this board..
Have you seen this before?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Brain Dead)
threads.message: Have same issue ,all rails present but no image no backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (2015)
